intro: Uapaca esculenta, commonly known as the velvet bean, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces pods that contain edible seeds, which are rich in protein and used as a food source. Its roots and leaves are also used in traditional medicine for their various health benefits. Uapaca esculenta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
